AFTER 5 DAYS RETURN TO
ENDICOTT JOHNSON CORPORATION
BETTER SHOES FOR EVERYBODY
S. E. COR. 12TH AND SPRUCE
РЕзК
LOUIS, MO
GAIN FIN
CHICAGO
ST. LOUIS
QUIS,
FEB 20*
330 PM
1928
ST. LOUIS.
MO.
2-20-28
(HOLD FOR COL. LINDBERGH
FLIGHT)
VIA AIR MAIL
Mr. Harold M. Bixby,
4th & Locust Streets,
St. Louis, Missouri.
10
SAVES

ENDICOTT JOYSON CORPORATION
BETTER SHOES FOR LESS MONEY
STlous Yo.
GREETINGS
Via
"WE"
On his return here February 13th at 5:01 o*clock
P. M., Colonel Charles A. Lindbergh, flying his
famous partner the Spirit of St. Louis,
completed
a tour of Good Will through Mexico, Central America,
a portion of South America, and the
tropical islands
that
lie off the Southeast coast of the United
States.
Just for old times sake, on February 20th and 21st
the Colonel is making & round trip flight over the
St. Louis-Chicago leg of the Air Mail route that
he traversed prior to his trans-Atlantic flighte
I take great pleasure in greeting you with this
letter carried by the famous combination "WE",
and
because this represents "Lindy'g" last air mail
flight, possibly you may wish to keep this letter
as a Souvenir.
Sincerely,
REL EL
Han Harold-
abittus Mrauso Manking
> for arrangughy flagle with the "colanf
to an cuatomas - Pogos.
properties.sfomuseum:description: Airmail flight cover commemorating Charles Lindbergh’s flight of contract air mail between Chicago and St. Louis, CAM-2 route; black horseshoe-shaped cachet with commemorative text “Lindbergh again flies the air mail”; postmarked February 20, 1928 in St. Louis, Missouri with cancellation mark over ten-cent airmail stamp; backstamp: February 21, 1928 in Chicago; addressed to Harold M. Bixby.a. envelopeb. Letter from Roger E. Lord to Harold Bixby, undated; single typewritten page with handwritten addendum; titled “Greetings via “WE” and references Charles Lindbergh’s final airmail flight.
properties.wof:name: airmail flight cover: Lindbergh airmail flight, CAM-2, Chicago to St. Louis route
